item.title: Lovense sex toy app flaw leaks private user email addresses
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: The connected sex toy platform Lovense is vulnerable to a zero-day flaw that allows an attacker to get access to a member's email address simply by knowing their username, putting them at risk of doxxing and harassment. [...]

item.title: Tea app leak worsens with second database exposing user chats
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: The Tea app data breach has grown into an even larger leak, with the stolen data now shared on hacking forums and a second database discovered that allegedly contains 1.1 million private messages exchanged between the app's members. [...]

item.title: Flaw in Gemini CLI AI coding assistant allowed stealthy code execution
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A vulnerability in Google's Gemini CLI allowed attackers to silently execute malicious commands and exfiltrate data from developers' computers using allowlisted programs. [...]

item.title: Endgame Gear mouse config tool infected users with malware
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Gaming peripherals maker Endgame Gear is warning that malware was hidden in its configuration tool for the OP1w 4k v2 mouse hosted on the official website between June 26 and July 9, 2025. [...]

item.title: Microsoft: macOS Sploitlight flaw leaks Apple Intelligence data
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Attackers could use a recently patched macOS vulnerability to bypass Transparency, Consent, and Control (TCC) security checks and steal sensitive user information, including Apple Intelligence cached data. [...]

item.title: Exploit available for critical Cisco ISE bug exploited in attacks
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Security researcher Bobby Gould has published a blog post demonstrating a complete exploit chain for CVE-2025-20281, an unauthenticated remote code execution vulnerability in Cisco Identity Services Engine (ISE). [...]

item.title: CISA flags PaperCut RCE bug as exploited in attacks, patch now
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: CISA warns that threat actors are exploiting a high-severity vulnerability in PaperCut NG/MF print management software, which can allow them to gain remote code execution in cross-site request forgery (CSRF) attacks. [...]

item.title: Microsoft will stop supporting Windows 11 22H2 in October
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft has reminded customers today that the last supported editions of Windows 11 22H2 will reach their end of servicing on October 14. [...]

item.title: OpenAI prepares GPT-5 for roll out
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: OpenAI's ChatGPT-5 could drop in the coming days, and it could be one of the best models from the Microsoft-backed startup. [...]

item.title: France's warship builder Naval Group investigates 1TB data breach
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: France's state-owned defense firm Naval Group is investigating a cyberattack after 1TB of allegedly stolen data was leaked on a hacking forum. [...]

item.title: OpenAI could rival Google Shopping with ChatGPT Shop
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: AI companies like OpenAI and Perplexity like to be the "everything company," and OpenAI's latest ChatGPT feature, "Shopping," makes that obvious. [...]

item.title: Internet Archive is now a US federal depository library
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: The Internet Archive has become an official U.S. federal depository library, providing online users with access to archived congressional bills, laws, regulations, presidential documents, and other U.S. government documents. [...]

item.title: Free Autoswagger Tool Finds the API Flaws Attackers Hope You Miss
item.dc:creator: Sponsored by Intruder
item.description: Exposed API documentation is a gift-wrapped roadmap for threat actors. The free Autoswagger tool from Intruder scans for exposed docs and flags endpoints with broken access controls—before attackers find them. [...]

item.title: Scattered Spider is running a VMware ESXi hacking spree
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Scattered Spider hackers have been aggressively targeting virtualized environments by attacking VMware ESXi hypervisors at U.S. companies in the retail, airline, transportation, and insurance sectors. [...]
